intro: Cacalia uncinata, commonly known as the hooked cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Cacalia uncinata typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas.
